intro: Euryops inops, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its showy yellow or orange ray florets and a central disk of smaller florets. It typically grows in open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. Euryops inops is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in dry conditions.
